abstract.t: This document specifies a specialization of the Spinel protocol to support Thread(R) networks.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: TODO: Writeme.

section.title: Requirements Language and Conventions
section.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in .

The layout diagrams in this document that show encodings of data in octet sequences use the convention described in Guide for Internet Standards Writers section 3.1, Packet Diagrams. Specifically, bits in octets are indexed from most significant to least significant, and the least significant bit in a field representing an integer value more than one bit in length is the least significant bit of a the signed or unsigned number, as the case requires.

section.title: Requirements
section.t: Thread(R) NCPs which adhere to this specification MUST also satisfy the following requirements:

list.t: The non-optional properties in the following sections MUST be implemented: CORE, PHY, MAC, NET, and IPV6.

section.t: All serious implementations of an NCP SHOULD also support the network save feature (See draft-rquattle-spinel-network-save).

section.title: Capabilities
section.t: The Thread(R) technology defines the following capabilities:

list.t: CAP_NET_THREAD_1_0 - Indicates that the NCP implements v1.0 of the Thread(R) standard.
CAP_NET_THREAD_1_1 - Indicates that the NCP implements v1.1 of the Thread(R) standard.

section.title: Properties
section.t: Properties for Thread(R) are allocated out of Spinel's Tech property section (see (draft-rquattle-spinel-core#property-sections)).

section.title: PROP 80: PROP_THREAD_LEADER_ADDR
section.t: The IPv6 address of the leader. (Note: May change to long and short address of leader)

section.title: PROP 81: PROP_THREAD_PARENT
section.t: The long address and short address of the parent of this node.

section.title: PROP 82: PROP_THREAD_CHILD_TABLE
section.t: Table containing the long and short addresses of all the children of this node.

section.title: PROP 83: PROP_THREAD_LEADER_RID
section.t: The router-id of the current leader.

section.title: PROP 84: PROP_THREAD_LEADER_WEIGHT
section.t: The leader weight of the current leader.

section.title: PROP 85: PROP_THREAD_LOCAL_LEADER_WEIGHT
section.t: The leader weight for this node.

section.title: PROP 86: PROP_THREAD_NETWORK_DATA
section.t: The local network data.

section.title: PROP 88: PROP_THREAD_STABLE_NETWORK_DATA
section.t: The local stable network data.

section.title: PROP 90: PROP_THREAD_ON_MESH_NETS
section.t: Data per item is:

list.t: b: "Is defined locally" flag. Set if this network was locally defined. Assumed to be true for set, insert and replace. Clear if the on mesh network was defined by another node.
S: The RLOC16 of the device that registered this on-mesh prefix entry. This value is not used and ignored when adding an on-mesh prefix.

section.title: PROP 91: PROP_THREAD_OFF_MESH_ROUTES
section.t: Data per item is:

list.t: b: "Is defined locally" flag. Set if this route info was locally defined as part of local network data. Assumed to be true for set, insert and replace. Clear if the route is part of partition's network data.

b: "Next hop is this device" flag. Set if the next hop for the route is this device itself (i.e., route was added by this device) This value is ignored when adding an external route. For any added route the next hop is this device.
S: The RLOC16 of the device that registered this route entry. This value is not used and ignored when adding a route.

section.title: PROP 93: PROP_THREAD_ALLOW_LOCAL_NET_DATA_CHANGE
section.t: Set to true before changing local net data. Set to false when finished. This allows changes to be aggregated into single events.

section.title: PROP 94: PROP_THREAD_MODE
section.t: This property contains the value of the mode TLV for this node. The meaning of the bits in this bitfield are defined by section 4.5.2 of the Thread(R) specification.

section.title: PROP 5376: PROP_THREAD_CHILD_TIMEOUT
section.t: Used when operating in the Child role.

section.title: PROP 5380: PROP_THREAD_NETWORK_ID_TIMEOUT
section.t: Allows you to get or set the Thread(R) NETWORK_ID_TIMEOUT constant, as defined by the Thread(R) specification.

section.title: PROP 5381: PROP_THREAD_ACTIVE_ROUTER_IDS

list.t: Packed-Encoding: A(C) (List of active thread router ids)

section.t: Note that some implementations may not support CMD_GET_VALUE router ids, but may support CMD_REMOVE_VALUE when the node is a leader.

section.title: PROP 5382: PROP_THREAD_RLOC16_DEBUG_PASSTHRU
section.t: Allow the HOST to directly observe all IPv6 packets received by the NCP, including ones sent to the RLOC16 address.
Default value is false.

section.title: PROP 5383: PROP_THREAD_ROUTER_ROLE_ENABLED
section.t: Allow the HOST to indicate whether or not the router role is enabled. If current role is a router, setting this property to false starts a re-attach process as an end-device.

section.title: PROP 5385: PROP_THREAD_ROUTER_SELECTION_JITTER
section.t: Specifies the self imposed random delay in seconds a REED waits before registering to become an Active Router.

section.title: PROP 5386: PROP_THREAD_PREFERRED_ROUTER_ID
section.t: Specifies the preferred Router Id. Upon becoming a router/leader the node attempts to use this Router Id. If the preferred Router Id is not set or if it can not be used, a randomly generated router id is picked. This property can be set only when the device role is either detached or disabled.

section.title: PROP 5387: PROP_THREAD_NEIGHBOR_TABLE
section.t: Data per item is:

list.t: b: true if neighbor is a child, false otherwise.

section.title: PROP 5388: PROP_THREAD_CHILD_COUNT_MAX
section.t: Specifies the maximum number of children currently allowed. This parameter can only be set when Thread(R) protocol operation has been stopped.

section.title: PROP 5389: PROP_THREAD_LEADER_NETWORK_DATA
section.t: The leader network data.

section.title: PROP 5390: PROP_THREAD_STABLE_LEADER_NETWORK_DATA
section.t: The stable leader network data.

section.title: PROP 5391: PROP_THREAD_JOINERS
section.t: Data per item is:
Passess Pre-Shared Key for the Device to the NCP in the commissioning process. When the Extended address is ommited all Devices which provided a valid PSKd are allowed to join the Thread(R) Network.

section.title: PROP 5392: PROP_THREAD_COMMISSIONER_ENABLED
section.t: Set to true to enable the native commissioner. It is mandatory before adding the joiner to the network.

section.title: PROP 5393: PROP_THREAD_TMF_PROXY_ENABLED
section.t: Set to true to enable the TMF proxy.

section.title: PROP 5394: PROP_THREAD_TMF_PROXY_STREAM
section.t: Data per item is:
This property allows the host to send and receive TMF messages from the NCP's RLOC address and support Thread-specific border router functions.

section.title: PROP 5395: PROP_THREAD_DISOVERY_SCAN_JOINER_FLAG
section.t: This property specifies the value used in Thread(R) MLE Discovery Request TLV during discovery scan operation. Default value is false.

section.title: PROP 5396: PROP_THREAD_DISCOVERY_SCAN_ENABLE_FILTERING
section.t: This property is used to enable/disable EUI64 filtering during discovery scan operation. Default value is false.

section.title: PROP 5397: PROP_THREAD_DISCOVERY_SCAN_PANID
section.t: This property specifies the PANID used for filtering during discovery scan operation. Default value is 0xffff (broadcast PANID) which disables PANID filtering.

section.title: PROP 5398: PROP_THREAD_STEERING_DATA
section.t: This property can be used to set the steering data for MLE Discovery Response messages.

list.t: All zeros to clear the steering data (indicating no steering data).
All 0xFFs to set the steering data (bloom filter) to accept/allow all.
A specific EUI64 which is then added to steering data/bloom filter.

section.title: Security Considerations
section.t: EDITOR: Insert verbiage here conforming to RFC Editor guidelines.

section.title: IANA Considerations
section.t: EDITOR: insert verbiage here: registry creation forms, et cetera.

list.t: Operating System, i.e. the IPv6 node using Spinel to control and manage one or more of its IPv6 network interfaces.
Physical layer. Refers to characteristics and parameters related to the physical implementation and operation of a networking medium.

section.title: Acknowledgments
section.t: Thread is a registered trademark of The Thread Group, Inc.
